intro: Sarothamnus striatus, commonly known as the striped thornstep, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing shrub with woody stems and small, needle-like leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Sarothamnus striatus is adapted to withstand drought and is an important plant in its native ecosystem.
